item.title: Diablo 4 Update Makes Big Changes to Season 8 Reputation Gains
item.description:
Summary

  • Blizzard increased Reputation gains in Diablo 4 Season 8 to ease player grind.
  • Reputation rates for various activities received significant boosts.
  • Changes aim to quicken progression and address player concerns promptly.

Blizzard has made significant changes to Reputation gains in a hotfix to Diablo 4 's Season 8, just days after its release. The new Diablo 4 update should alleviate some of the issues with the grind that players have been experiencing in Season 8.

Diablo 4 Season 8 was released on April 29 to a heavily mixed response from players. The grind to reach the endgame content in Diablo 4 Season 8 hasn't gone down well with all players, and the same goes for the reduced number of rare items being dropped, especially in the early game. Despite the criticism of Diablo 4 's new Seasonal offerings, it seems it hasn't fallen on deaf ears, with Blizzard already acting fast to rectify the problems.

The patch notes for the new Diablo 4 hotfix have made some massive changes to Reputation rates across various activities. Diablo 4 's World Bosses have seen the biggest increase, going from 250 to 2,000 per kill. Defeating Lair Bosses will now earn 1,000 Reputation as opposed to the previous 750, while taking down Belial, Lord of Lies will now award 1,500 (up from 1,000). Blood Maidens have also seen a considerable Reputation boost, giving players 1,000 per kill from 250. Finally, regular Bosses now offer 750 Reputation per kill, a substantial increase from 250.

This increase will allow players to progress through their Seasonal Reputation board much quicker than before, reducing the grind associated with Diablo 4 Season 8. Among the short list of hotfix changes, it was also confirmed that Apparition Incursion Bosses have now had their health reduced, which should assist those who were previously struggling. While the mixed reception to the new Season is understandable, it's good that Blizzard is making swift and radical changes to address the perceived issues.

Looking beyond Season 8, there should still be plenty more Diablo 4 to come. It was even recently revealed that Diablo 4 could come to the Nintendo Switch 2, which would be interesting if it came to fruition. Even despite the mixed reception to Season 8, players can expect more changes and fixes over the coming weeks to address even more of the problems that players are having with the new content.

Diablo 4 Season 8 Hotfix 2 Patch Notes for May 2, 2025

  • Reputation rewards for various activities have been increased:
    • World Boss: Increased from 250 to 2000.
    • Lair Boss: Increased from 750 to 1000.
    • Belial, Lord of Lies (Lair Boss Ambush): Increased from 1000 to 1500.
    • Blood Maiden: Increased from 250 to 1000.
    • Regular Boss: Increased from 250 to 750.-

  • Apparition Incursion Bosses have had their Health reduced, particularly at lower levels.
  • Various Stability improvements.

item.title: What is the Manor Family Canvas Used for in Clair Obscur Expedition 33?
item.description:
During Act 3 of Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 , you will get to unlock the flying ability for Esquie , allowing you and your party the power to travel all over The Continent with ease.

Once you have this ability, dozens of new locations will be accessible, such as a sub-location called The Canvas . In this area, you'll find a key item called the Manor Family Canvas . However, the game doesn't tell you what it's used for. This guide will show you the frame it needs to be placed into and the rewards you'll get in Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 .

Where is The Canvas in Clair Obscur Expedition 33?

High Up

You can find the location known as ' The Canvas ' in the northwestern section of the map, just northwest of Sirene. The portal will be on top of a floating rock , so you'll need Esquie's flight ability to reach it.

Once you enter the location, you will find a huge frame on the floor with a picture of the Dessendre family. Take the Manor Family Canvas out of the frame. Next, we need to return to the Manor .

What to do with the Manor Family Canvas in Clair Obscur Expedition 33

You need to take the portrait to The Manor (this is the mysterious place with all the rooms and locked doors connected to all the maps through somewhat hidden doors).

You can get to the Manor via any of those doors you've seen on your journey, like the one in Gestral Village or Flying Waters near the Noco's Hut Rest Point.

Once you reach the Manor's main entrance, look up the stairs and to the right to see the large empty frame . Interact with it, and you can place the Manor Family Canvas into it . Doing this will unlock a door down the hallway closest to you, past some very long dining tables.

Enter the unlocked room to find a Journal with an unknown author and a new outfit for Maelle called 'Painted Me.'

item.title: All Mythic Weapons in Fortnite x Star Wars, Ranked
item.description:
Star Wars x Fortnite : Galactic Battle brings forth new legendary Mythic weapons for players to wield into battle to try and get a Victory Royale. Upon the release of Fortnite 's Galactic Battle season, there are 7 Mythics for players to try out, but how does one get them all, and which are worth getting so players know how to thrive in a fight?

Listed below are every Mythic weapon in Fortnite Galactic Battle so that players will have knowledge on their side before they jump out of the Battle Bus and hunt down their favorite weapon of choice to rule the galaxy and get a dub.

More Mythics will be added throughout Fortnite Galactic Battle, so be sure to check in for the latest Mythic weapons to see how to get them and where they rank.

Sith Apprentice Lightsaber (Force Saber Throw)

How to Get the Sith Apprentice Lightsaber with Force Saber Throw in Fortnite

  • How to Get the Sith Apprentice Lightsaber: Accept training from Darth Vader at Vader Samurai's Solitude after he has been defeated in battle.

One of the two Mythic Sith Apprentice Lightsabers can be found with Darth Vader, and despite the power of this Sith Lord, his lightsaber is lacking somewhat. The only special thing about this lightsaber is that it has the Force Saber Throw, which allows players to throw the lightsaber, and if it hits enemies, that's 70 damage. The length of the throw is rather short, even if the cooldown is a generous 2 seconds, and considering players are vulnerable when they throw the lightsaber since they cannot block, this one is a tad riskier than others.

Jedi Padawan Lightsaber

How to Get the Jedi Padawan Lightsaber with Force Push in Fortnite

  • How to Get the Jedi Padawan Lightsaber: Accept training from Rey's Hologram, found at random spots on the map, noted by the blue lightsaber symbol.

The Jedi Padawan Lightsaber might look cool, but it's not the most useful when it comes to a fight. Hitting enemies for 40 damage is great, and the fact that it can deflect a few shots is nice, but it's a standard lightsaber that doesn't offer much protection once players are receiving sustained fire. Additionally, the Jedi Padawan Lightsaber has a Force Push ability which doesn't push players very far nor damage them, so it's best used to keep enemies away and for not much else.

Mythic DL-44 Blaster Pistol

How to Get the Enhanced DL-44 Blaster Pistol in Fortnite

  • How to Get the DL-44 Blaser Pistol: Defeat Shogun X at Shogun's Arena, which spawns randomly after the 4th Storm Circle.
  • Special effects: Enhanced damage while aiming down sights.

Damage

43 (Hipfire)

91 (Aim Down Sights)

Critical Hit Damage

51 (Hipfire)

101 (Aim Down Sights)

Fire Rate

3.35

The DL-44 Blaster Pistol is pretty good, as it has limited recoil when it's being aimed or even shot with hipfire. It sounds great, looks great, and feels very satisfying to shoot at long distances for a pretty decent chunk of damage, yet there's a problem. The DL-44 Blaster Pistol takes a while to get, as players will need to wait until the 4th Storm Circle, which is pretty far into the game, and then they will need to draw attention to themselves by fighting the extreme health pool of Shogun X which could cause them to be killed by other players.

Sith Apprentice Lightsaber (Force Lightning)

How to Get the Sith Apprentice Lightsaber with Force Lightning in Fortnite

  • How to Get the Sith Apprentice Lightsaber: Accept training from Palpatine's Hologram, found at random spots on the map, noted by the red lightsaber symbol.

Emperor Palpatine has the best lightsaber in Fortnite, providing players with a Sith Apprentice Lightsaber that has the Force Lightning ability attached. While on its own, the Sith Apprentice Lightsaber is just the same as all the others, it's the Force Lightning that makes up for it. With a whopping 18-second cooldown, Force Lightning will crackle and pop enemies for 30 damage per second it's attached, and it can also be used to deactivate vehicles like TIE Fighters and X-Wings.

Mythic IQA-11 Marksman Blaster Rifle

How to Get the Enhanced IQA-11 Marksman Blaster Rifle in Fortnite

  • How to Get the IQA-11 Marksman Rifle: Head to the hill northeast of Rolling Blossoms Farm and provide General Grievous with a Jedi Padawan Lightsaber.
  • Special effects: Enhanced cooling systems to allow shooting for longer before overheating.

Damage

76

Critical Hit Damage

148

Fire Rate

1.9

Sniper Rifles are always worth grabbing due to how they can turn the tide of war at a distance, and the IQA-11 Marksman Blaster Rifle is no exception to that fact. This weapon has a great rate of fire and shots that deal plenty of damage. The only real issue with the IQA-11 Marksman Blaster Rifle is that to obtain it, players must wait for Rey's Hologram to spawn, and then they need to be the first ones to grab the Jedi Padawan Lightsaber just so they can exchange it with General Grievous for the gun they seek.

Mythic F-11D Blaster

How to Get the Captain Phasma's F-11D Blaster Rifle in Fortnite

  • How to Get the F-11D Blaster: Defeat Captain Phasma, who is found at the First Order Base.
  • Special effects: Enhanced fire rate and equip speed.

Damage

30

Critical Hit Damage

45

Fire Rate

6.65

There's nothing wrong with being the default choice, which is exactly why the F-11D ranks so high as a must-have. The F-11D Blaster is the generic assault rifle of the First Order, but this variant from Captain Phasma provides players with a faster rate of fire and equip speed to make sure it beats out the competition of inferior models.

Mythic A280-CFE Blaster Rifle

How to Get the Enhanced A280-CFE Blaster Rifle in Fortnite

  • How to Get the A280-CFE: Complete the Train Heist.
  • Special effects: Enhanced critical damage.

Damage

35

Critical Hit Damage

58

Fire Rate

4.25

The A280-CFE is extremely underrated as a weapon, and the Mythic variant proves just that. Not only is this weapon extremely easy to acquire simply by dropping from the Battle Bus and activating the train heist, but it's a gun that has a scope, which, for a hitscan weapon, is a game changer. The A280-CFE Blaster Rifle dominates the competition with its reliability at medium-range and long-range engagements, and while the recoil might be a tad steep, players can counter it by using the weapon by tapping the trigger instead of holding it for sustained damage.

item.title: One Type of DC Game Could Kill Three Birds With One Stone
item.description:
The DC gaming landscape is currently fractured, with canceled projects, creative reboots, and half-realized ideas making up its current state. One potential fix would not lie in sprawling open worlds or an Arkhamverse rehash. Instead, a single, well-thought-out Trinity game, starring Batman, Superman, and Wonder Woman, could be a clear moment of course-correction for the DC brand. A semi-linear experience that lets players control each member of the Trinity, with tailored mechanics, a comic-accurate tone, and genuine stakes could be a winning combination.

Obviously, making such a game would be no easy task, as a developer would need to deliver three definitive experiences in one cohesive game. Warner Bros. has tried to separate its DC characters into standalone franchises after the success of Batman: Arkham , but the reality is that it hasnt worked out well as audience expectations have evolved. Even Marvel, after standout solo hits like Spider-Man and the upcoming Wolverine , has embraced a shared experience with Marvel Rivals and some DC fans will be craving that same unified direction. A Trinity game can provide a fresh experience starring multiple heroes, but keep the singleplayer element that the Arkhamverse thrived on.

A Trinity Game Solves Three Major Problems

The first problem that would be solved by a combined title is the Batman void . Gotham Knights failed to inspire, and Suicide Squad alienated fans. Reviving Arkham -style gameplay inside a new title, alonside segments focused on Diana and Clark, could bridge nostalgia and progression. Fans adored Arkham 's tight combat, mood, and detective-centric immersion. A Trinity game can bring these things back without recycling the same old DC villains or settings, while also featuring characters that provide gameplay opportunities Bruce Wayne does not.

The second problem such a game could address Supermans gameplay dilemma . Decades of failed prototypes stem from trying to make him fun and balanced, but a Trinity game would inherently sidestep this issue, as the entirety of the game would not need to be built around him. Instead of offering a game where players are freely flying across Metropolis, a potential Trinity title could have Superman dropping in for key moments like disaster rescue, alien threats, and significant confrontations. This way, he'd become a controlled burst of power, not a problem to balance, as potential solo game issues like environmental destruction and civilians being hurt by the Man of Steel's many battles would be irrelevant.

Wonder Womans Time to Shine

The reported cancellation of Wonder Womans solo title leaves a major gap in DC's lineup, and thats the third angle a Trinity game addresses. Diana Prince is a core pillar of DC, yet she's never had a game, and sadly her first big chance at that opportunity has collapsed. A Trinity title can place her front and center in her own segments. A studio could give her an immersive arena to do battle in, be it Themyscira, war-torn cities, or mythological realms, and from there the developers could lean into melee, whip mechanics, and moral conflict. She could finally be placed on equal footing as Bruce and Clark, not just being treated as a supporting character like she is in franchises like Injustice .

This hypothetical game doesn't need to be another sprawling, Ubisoft-style open-world game, nor should it go the Suicide Squad route of being live-service game. A Trinity title should be kept lean and structured, perhaps taking inspiration from something like Jedi: Fallen Order or Guardians of the Galaxy where strong writing, tight mechanics, and a defined scope are clear strengths. The game's structure could see players alternate between the three heroes, either through a chapter-based design or seamless story transitions, with each segment playing to that heros specific strengths. Team-up moments could take place throughout, with all three characters coming together for the biggest and most important battles.

A game starring the Trinity could rebuild the brand's reputation following recent DC game launches. A Batman arc that honors the Arkham legacy, a Superman segment that proves he can indeed "work" in a game, and a spotlight for Wonder Woman thats long overdue are all opportunities that could be explored in such a game, and hopefully it becomes a reality one day.

item.title: Genshin Impact Voice Actor Could Be Back Sooner Than Expected
item.description:
Summary

  • Erika Harlacher-Stone has teased that they will return as Venti in 5.6.
  • Genshin Impact has struggled to bring back a majority of its English cast since Version 5.1.

Erika Harlacher-Stone, the beloved voice actress of Venti in Genshin Impact , has implied that she will be back to play the Anemo Archon in Version 5.6. As a result of the SAG-AFTRA strike, Genshin Impact has struggled to bring back a majority of its English cast since Version 5.1. While players were initially patient with the situation, the recasting of Kinich in Version 5.5 caused controversy. Takanashi, a voice actor based in Tokyo, replaced John Patneaude as Kinich. He is the first (and so far only) recast made by Genshin Impact as a result of the strike.

While the situation around the strike and HoYoverse is complex, voice actors such as Joe Zieja have attempted to clarify some of the misconceptions circulating across the Genshin Impact community. Given that Genshin Impact isn't a union project, it is technically not a part of the SAG-AFTRA strike, and would thus be more accurate to call the situation a collective refusal to work. As such, it has enabled certain voice actors to return to the role, as well as allowed Paimon in Genshin Impact to retain her English voice throughout the strike.

Version 5.6 takes the Traveler and Paimon back to Mondstadt for its Archon Quest, and as such, players are already bracing for another silent update in Genshin Impact . Unfortunately, the upcoming Archon Quest is meant to be a major crossroads in the overarching story, as it will bring important lore figures to the fold, such as Varka, Durin, and the Hexenzirkel. That being said, Erika Harlacher-Stone has revealed that Venti in Genshin Impact could have his voice back during Version 5.6, as she has been eager to return to the role for months.

Venti's Voice Actor Could Return to Genshin Impact in Version 5.6

Erika is adored by the Genshin Impact community, and her return would certainly make Venti fans happy. While it remains to be seen if her choice will trigger other voice actors to come back to Genshin Impact , Harlacher-Stone notably took a stance against SAG-AFTRA when she claimed that the union was sending threatening letters to her and other actors (including financial core members). Corina Boettger, the voice of Paimon, spoke out against the claim. Allegra Clark, who voices Beidou in Genshin Impact , expressed a desire for the situation to be resolved soon and lamented how much the industry has changed within the span of a year.

From a content standpoint, Version 5.6 is split into two major parts: the Mondstadt storyline and its Flagship Event in Fontaine. Genshin Impact players can expect all new characters to be voiced going forward, but fan favorites, such as Navia, will remain silent in Version 5.6. Escoffier will make her debut in Genshin Impact during Version 5.6, and fans will be able to obtain the 5-Star Cryo Polearm on the Event Banners. Version 5.6 is set to launch on May 7, 2025.
